answers.text:
In Arizona there is an option to form a special services district, a special taxing district, for enhanced services.  If the demand is there, this form of district creates a participative solution: you have the ability to sell the district as a direct-benefit tax structure.  The law is Arizona Revised Statutes s. 48-575 (http://www.azleg.state.az.us/FormatDocument.asp?inDoc=/ars/48/00575.htm&Title=48&DocType=ARS).

author: Thomas Moton
text: How are Town/Gown communities and those communities with a significant number of night clubs in their downtowns handling significant costs of providing law enforcement to deter crime and promote oublic safety?  Do any of you have bar/nightclub or entertainment tax or fee---that is, a tax/fee exacted on the entities that are generating the demand for above normal law enforcement demand.
title: Downtown Nightclubs and costs of law enforcement
